name: Hotel Mediolanum Milan

reviews.title: One of Milan's Finest and Trendiest
reviews.text: Hotel Mediolanum was VERY cute. Complete with impeccably clean restrooms, linens, and lobby. I was very impressed with the cleanliness of the hotel, as well as the WONDERFUL breakfast buffet served. The staff was very friendly, the use of the hotel's computer was easy and painless, and the location is close (very close) to the train station, corso Buenos Aires, and other little places of interest.

reviews.title: Convenient to central train station
reviews.text: If you need a convenient place to stay within walking distance to the central train station, this is a good choice. We stayed here for one night to be close the train station as our train left very early the next morning. The modernly-decorated rooms are certainly not luxury and the beds & pillows are on the hard side, but the bathrooms are clean and quite large. Staff was nice and helpful.

reviews.title: Expected better from a four star Hotel
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for three nights in February .The hotel advertises itself as four star but in reality struggles to be three star . Rooms were small and very basic and fairly clean .Im not sure if the 70's retro styling was deliberate or just original.We were quite lucky in the fact that our room was dark orange and therefore not as bright as some of the others .All rooms face the road and meant that earplugs were needed to sleep .

reviews.title: Cut the glare in the rooms!
reviews.text: The bathroom was clean but very small with shower only .Not sure which rooms have the baths that are shown on their website.

reviews.title: very enjoyable experience
reviews.text: Breakfast was very basic self service with no hot food but typical of continental Europe .

reviews.title: Mediolanum- more like mediocre!
reviews.text: The hotel is located very close to the train station and it was therefore easy to get around . We also noted that the road leading to the hotel from the station was frequented by "working" girls ,which didnt bother us but may offend some.

reviews.title: Hotel Mediolanum
reviews.text: Overall our stay at the Mediolanum was OK. We arrived by train and were glad that the hotel was a 5 minute walk from the train station. The staff were polite but not warm and welcoming, nor very helpful. They basically just did what was required, not more.

reviews.title: Impressed by design and location
reviews.text: Extremely convenient location: within walking distance from the Central Station & close to the tourist/shopping center. Well designed rooms that are cleaned every day with fresh towels and all necessary bath supplements. Friendly personnel. One drawback: broken lock box in the room that refused to open following the input of the programmed password by the hotel guests but was easily opened by one the hotel servant with the press of only one button (the lock box did not behave as was described in the instruction). Who needs the lock box that is managed not by its owner but by any hotel servant? Best way to avoid this problem is not to use the safe box. Everything else is perfect.

reviews.title: wonderful place to stay
reviews.text: The hotel is at a great location. It is very close to the main train station and it is very clean and roomy. The bathroom was very big compare to other restrooms in italian hotels. The staff was pretty okay they werent 100% happy but they were pretty nice and told us how to get to all the places we wanted to visit while we were there. The bed was kind of hard but nice and warm.

reviews.title: chic hotel...
reviews.text: I WILL DEFINETELY STAY THERE THE NEXT TIME I GO TO MILAN.

reviews.title: Mediolanum, my foot !!!
reviews.text: This was a great little find... thanks to trip advisor! We really loved it here and the staff were ultra friendly! It's really close to the train station and a walk to the city center! There is a sister hotel that you can use the gym at too which is great! The rooms were ultra funky and bright, clean and fresh! Breakfast was just okay.

reviews.title: room good, staff unfriendly
reviews.text: As far as Milan goes though as a place to visit, there's not all that much to really see or do compaired to other places in Italy! The shopping was expensive and disappointing! I would recommend Verona! We just loved it there! It's got plenty to see and do and the shopping was wonderful!

description: The Hotel Mediolanum is a modern 4 stars business hotel member of the international chain Worldhotels. The hotel has been recently renovated following the last trends of the international hotellerie. The common spaces show bright colours as prevailing and shapes inspired by the contemporary design: the interiors recall the style of famous architects like Zanuso and Le Corbusier.The Hotel is located in a strategic position thanks to the closeness of the Central Station (MM2 Green Subway Line): fulcrum of the city of Milano and Air Terminal. At a small range of few hundred of meters from Via Mauro Macchi you can find the subway stations of Porta Venezia (MM1 Red Line with direct connection to the congress center and exhibition quarter) and Repubblica (MM3 Yellow Line). The railway link stops in both and it connects with the nearby cities. The heart of the city is reachable on foot: in 10 minutes you can arrive to the historical part of the town where the Duomo (Cathedral) and the Teatro La Scala (Opera House) stand.In the hotel's surroundings you can find the Garibaldi Station (high speed train terminal).The 51 Mediolanum rooms will put you in direct contact with the emotions caused by the colours: the light fills up the interiors which get painted of lively, passionate, relaxing colours. On this trail the Superior and Deluxe rooms were realized following the principles of the chromotherapy. This science links the psychical and physical wellbeing to the tones. The buttonhole flower of this rooms is the remote controller placed next to the bed thanks to which you can change the lighting in red, blue, green or yellow or mix them up. According to your mood and needs you can switch to a relaxing green, or to a concentrating purple. All the rooms All the rooms are soundproof and equipped with air conditioning, parquet floor, free satellite TV, telephone, Wi-Fi and safe.Inside the hotel the guests can have a seat in the elegant lounge bar where a pleasant appetizer is served together with refreshing cocktails. At the light restaurant you can taste a special selection of the best Italian dishes enriched by refined wines. The Business corner is equipped with a PC with internet connection, a printer, fax and a photocopier and it is always at the guests' disposal. In addition at the Hotel Sanpi, located just 300 mt away under the same management, you have access to the modern fitness room Technogym wellness and to the meeting room Venezia.The Hotel Mediolanum Milano is member of the international hotel chain Worldhotels and it is identified by the code WW in the GDS systems. The reservations can be done directly or via gds or internet.thank you for your attention and time.
